title: Joint Variation
text: Joint variation occurs when a variable varies directly or inversely with multiple variables. For instance, if $$x$$ varies directly with both $$y$$ and $$z$$, we have $$x=k y z$$. If $$x$$ varies directly with $$y$$ and inversely with $$z$$, we have $$x=\frac{k y}{z}$$. Notice that we only use one constant in a joint variation equation.
